intro: Falcataria falcata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mangrove, is a species of flowering plant in the family Meliaceae. It is native to coastal regions of Southeast Asia and is adapted to saline and brackish water environments. The plant has elongated, narrow leaves that are often submerged or floating, aiding in its survival in tidal zones. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. Falcataria falcata plays an important role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various marine and terrestrial species.
